node.title: Drake Earns a Fifth Week at No. 1 Ahead of Music’s Major Fall Releases
node.alt: Drake’s five weeks at the top of the Billboard 200 so far this year with “Certified Lover Boy” match the stay of his previous album, “Scorpion,” in 2018, according to Billboard.
node.description: With new albums by Ed Sheeran, Taylor Swift and Adele looming, the rapper’s “Certified Lover Boy” remains atop the Billboard chart.
node.content: ["Before Ed Sheeran, Taylor Swift and Adele make themselves known on the Billboard album chart, there is still Drake.", "In the absence of much competition, the rapper\u2019s latest album, \u201cCertified Lover Boy,\u201d logged its fifth nonconsecutive week at No. 1 with the equivalent of 74,000 sales in the United States, including 100 million streams and fewer than 1,000 copies sold as a complete package in its eighth week out, according to MRC Data.", "But major releases loom this fall as formidable challengers: Sheeran\u2019s new album, \u201c=,\u201d pronounced \u201cequals,\u201d was released on Friday and will make its chart debut next week, while Swift\u2019s rerecorded version of \u201cRed,\u201d from 2012 \u2014 now called \u201cRed (Taylor\u2019s Version)\u201d \u2014 is due out Nov. 12.", "Yet even those top-selling singer-songwriters should enjoy their likely spots at No. 1 while they last, as the new album from Adele, \u201c30,\u201d is scheduled for release on Nov. 19, and is shaping up to be another blockbuster.", "Drake\u2019s five weeks at the top of the Billboard 200 so far this year with \u201cCertified Lover Boy\u201d match the stay of his previous album, \u201cScorpion,\u201d in 2018, according to Billboard. And it ties his second-longest reign for a release, trailing the 13 weeks at No. 1 for his 2016 album, \u201cViews.\u201d", "\u201cCertified Lover Boy\u201d is followed on this week\u2019s chart by some of the year\u2019s most consistently popular releases, including \u201cDangerous: The Double Album\u201d by Morgan Wallen at No. 2; \u201cPlanet Her\u201d by Doja Cat at No. 3; \u201cSincerely, Kentrell\u201d by YoungBoy Never Broke Again at No. 4; and \u201cSour\u201d by Olivia Rodrigo at No. 5.", "New albums by Lana Del Rey (\u201cBlue Banisters,\u201d No. 8) and Elton John (the collaborative \u201cThe Lockdown Sessions,\u201d No. 10) were the top debuts of the week."]
